pull.title: guix: bump time-machine to 7bf1d7aeaffba15c4f680f93ae88fbef25427252
pull.body:
Includes:
https://git.savannah.gnu.org/cgit/guix.git/commit/?id=d428237642e1e4ac8fda4597205ffec89926c0ec.

which removes the need to build Python2, and OpenSSL `1.x` (which has historically caused issues) when building for Windows (Python2 (with a dependency on OpenSSL `1.x`) used to be a dependency of NSIS).

Linux Kernel Headers `6.1.100` -> `6.1.102`

author fanquake <fanquake@gmail.com> 1722527851 +0100
committer fanquake <fanquake@gmail.com> 1723110283 +0100

guix: bump time-machine to 7bf1d7aeaffba15c4f680f93ae88fbef25427252

Includes:
https://git.savannah.gnu.org/cgit/guix.git/commit/?id=d428237642e1e4ac8fda4597205ffec89926c0ec.

which removes the need to build Python2, and OpenSSL 1.x when building
for Windows.

Includes:

which removes the need to build Python2, and OpenSSL 1.x when building
for Windows.

If your review is incorrectly listed, please react with 👎 to this comment and the bot will ignore it on the next update.

Very nice.

Tested with:

```
guix time-machine --commit=7bf1d7aeaffba15c4f680f93ae88fbef25427252 -- graph nsis-x86_64 --type=bag | grep openssl
guix time-machine --commit=efc26826400762207cde9f23802cfe75a737963c -- graph nsis-x86_64 --type=bag | grep openssl

Nice, ACK eca20bead2daec4898ecf608cdeb74a73766a5f4
